website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for consumers with small projects and those who are more concerned with overall price than versatility; it's not useful for many larger woodworking tasks.
pros: Kreg's jig system that is geared to small projects, repairs, and novice woodworkers
Boasts the same quality of Kreg's other jig systems
Easy to learn to use and simple to adjust
Comes with a handy storage case
cons: Doesn't come with a clamp – though it can be used without one, it's more challenging to master on its own

customer_reviews.title: Craft like a Pro.
customer_reviews.text: I made two interior sliding "barn" doors for my daughter's home with the Kreg R3. The joints were solid, strong and hidden. Looked like the Pros made them. I've been wood crafting for 50 years I only wished i discovered this little wonder earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Craig S. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pocket Hole Jig
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this thing for a couple years now. I bought this mostly to build some sturdy shelving and work bench at my house. It has done a great job. This thing creates rock solid joints especially with a little wood glue in the joint as well. I used this primarily with irwin quik grip clamps for holding it in place while drilling holes and it works very well for me. I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little Jig
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jig to make a farm table for my wife, it was our turn to host Thanksgiving and we didn't have a dining table big enough for our family, so I decided to make one. It made the assembly so much easier! Didn't have a single board crack on me. It was the first time I used it so I was reluctant to even purchase it but boy am I glad i did. Only thing is I wish I would have bought the bigger one because now I want to make other projects.
customer_reviews.author: OPC

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This Kreg was my first experience with pocket holes. Why have I waited? I have always been a DIY kind of person, but pocket jigs seems too difficult for me to even try. I am so glad I finally did. They were easy to line up and use and I have made shelves already that are sturdier than anything else I have built. This is now a must have item. The only downside is the price of the special screws needed.
customer_reviews.author: Snow cone Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic breaks off.
customer_reviews.text: I love building with pocket holes. I have been using a single kreg pocket jig from one of the box stores for years now. I finally got the double jig. Unfortunately, the plastic on this one is weak. The mount broke after first use and the inner part of the jig chips off every use. I didn't use it within my return window so I can't return it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it often, but...
customer_reviews.text: There's a disk that attaches to the jig that's used for clamping. The disk often unclips itself. It can also be a pain to set the clamp position (which varies depending on the thickness of the wood) because it tends to move during the clamping process. I'm a fan of pocket holes, and Kreg products. My suggestion though, is that it's worth spending more to get the bigger K4 system. I spent over $50 on this little one and I can make it work, but the bigger system is easier to use, so I'm going to end up paying for 2 systems. Spend more and get the K4 - save yourself money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L VanOrmer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Easy to use works great! Made an epic table with it!
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I thought I should have gotten the more expensive one with the built-in clamp, but this is easy to move and re-clamp once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B.

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOOL EVER! IT'S A MUST-HAVE!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this product! If I could give it a 10 Stars I would! I use this pocket hole jig quite a bit and have had it for several years. Never have had to replace any of the parts. Very well-made and thought of. Good quality at a great price! I started making my own kitchen cabinets, bathroom cabinets, and several other things with this product. It's a must-have! Seller was great and was shipped in a timely manner. I love this tool so much that I use it all the time
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Dysert

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool. Sometimes a pocket hole is the best way to join 2 pieces.
customer_reviews.text: OK, I'm not a professional or even advanced amateur wood worker. I'm certainly no cabinet maker. But often enough I found myself trying to join two pieces of wood, either parallel horizontal or perpendicular 90 degrees and usually ending up with something that seemed pretty Mickey Mouse. Well those days are over for $40 bucks. After using it a few times it may be worth more than $40 in time saved, aggravation and a very strong, finished & professional joint. If'n he had fingers I could teach my dg how to use this pocket hole. Frankly its one of the most useful tools I've bought in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: HutchyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Defective Kreg Jig R3
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Kreg Jig R3 to make two pocket holes. One of the holes was defective, sealed with the blue plastic and although the drill broke through and made a small hole (I didn't realize it was defective until this), the drill can break through any further. I would likely keep it if the drill could go through and create a pocket hole, but looks like I'll have to return it. I was ready to start my project so this is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie O.

customer_reviews.title: Kreg R-3 Promo
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for a DIY home wood working person. I kept seeing this in allot of diy patterns and had no experience using one. I’ve come to use it almost as often as my miter box and vacuum. Very easy to use, set your wood depth, set your bit depth, and GO to work. I’ve yet to use the pan head screws it came with, I’ve been using sheet rock and deck screws with it. I’ve done many picture frames with 1/2” & 3/4” material, used it to make canvas stretchers (frames) of 1x2 poplar, build out door furniture from scrap 2x4/2x6 and joined 1x8 to make 16” wide boards.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: My second Kreg pocket-hole jig...
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Kreg MKJKIT, which is a basic one-hole jig, for over a year so this R3 is just an addition to box full of Kreg tools. It is handier than the mini-jig in some situations and more cumbersome in others. The two compliment each other overall. I am sold on the Kreg system. I have not used my biscuit wafer joiner since I started using the Kreg system. The Kreg system is much faster than cutting biscuit wafers joints, bar clamping and waiting for glue to dry. I still keep my table router handy for tongue-in-groove joints but, depending on the precise application, I often use the Kreg system instead of tongue-in-groove.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: The tool is fantastic, well made, and mostly complete. The screws were supposed to come with the kit, waited for an extra 3 weeks, finally gave up and made a trip to Home Depot. Would have been 5 stars if the kit was complete
customer_reviews.author: CORZeroCO

customer_reviews.title: ... know why I waited so long to get this great item. I have always drilled pocket holes by ...
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know why I waited so long to get this great item. I have always drilled pocket holes by hand, but this takes the guess work out of the process. The pocket holes come out perfect every time. Easy to use, easily portable with or without the great case that is included. I would recommend this item to anyone new to woodworking and frankly, it is a great investment for the seasoned woodworker too. I did purchase the Kreg clamp specifically made for the system too and would recommend it as well.
customer_reviews.author: emeraldequine

customer_reviews.title: Must-have tool
customer_reviews.text: This kit is fantastic. I like the versatility of it, and comprehensiveness of the kit. I wish it came with more wood plugs, but that is a small point to make. I've been able to find more at the larger chain hardware stores, and have started using a dowel rod instead. I've used this kit for several projects, and it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: You will use this all the time! (probably)
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice woodworker. The pocket hole system is virtually foolproof and necessary for a do-it-yourself-er to build a multitude of wood projects without complicated techniques or expensive equipment. With the kreg jig system, a drill, and a circular saw, I have built a train table, bench,entryway hutch, bookcase, and a dresser that I am actually not ashamed to have on display in my house! (see picture of hutch I built using only those three tools) Seriously though, get it. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: waggs5302

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I did a project that required more than 250 butt joints, This little jig and the clamping tool were a lifesaver. If you only have a few holes to do you could probably use a C-clamp. However, if you have a lot of holes to do I strongly recommend including the clamp with your purchase. Also keep in mind that the drill bit is designed for washer head screws. I used normal deck screws in the first 50 holes but about 1 of 5 connections ended up splitting the wood when I snugged them tight. I bought some of the Kreg screws and had no more problems. The jig is expensive, but it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Level up your furniture making game!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! If you are doing a lot of wood working I would say spend more for the fancier Kreg Jig Systems that are offered. These products are worth the money. I build only a few pieces of furniture a year and am still somewhat of a novice. This set is perfect for me and has taken my skills up a notch...;)... I really love this product and even bought one for a wood working friend! Just follow instructions closely for adjusting depth of drill bit according to proper screw size until you get used to using it.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but,
customer_reviews.text: the death collar on mine has dug a groove into the drill bit after just a few times of using. Now when I make my setting it usually rides up the bit and screws my hole depth. To be fair I haven't asked for a replacement yet from Kreg, but it still shouldn't have happened. And of course the only time I remember I need to contact them is when I go to use my kit.. Good tool though, I should contact them and ask for a replacement collar and bit. I'll try to remember to add a pic but if you ever used or watch someone use a kit like this, you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: It turned out great and very professional looking thanks to this pocket jig
customer_reviews.text: I build a large patio table and used this jig for it. It turned out great and very professional looking thanks to this pocket jig. I wish there was an all-metal version as I noticed occasionally blue plastic bits would expel via the drill-bit. Also, when clamping it down, I had to be careful not to clamp to hard to not crack it. The sliders for the length are great, but I wish there was a way to lock in the size better. After doing about a dozen holes, I had to be sure the length didn't change. I still recommend this product to anyone wanting an easy way to assemble furniture or like projects.
customer_reviews.author: KitkatJohn

customer_reviews.title: its not the holy grail, disappointed in the abilities of this tool
customer_reviews.text: the guidance provided with this tool is not that great, it is a lot of figuring out and the ability to use anything beyond a 2x4 doesnt seem to be possible. the kit itself is nice with a nice case, the number of screws provided is limited and costly if you get them separately. it was supposed to come with a clamp, but it was not in my package. amazon refused to send me one, i needed to return this set and order a new one, too much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: xander

customer_reviews.title: Good, but cumbersome.
customer_reviews.text: A better option than cheaper/off brand products, but is kindof a pain for wider stock. In order to get properly spaced holes in a 2x4, one must clamp the jig against one side of the material, drill one hole, then unclamp and reclamp on the other side. If you center the jig and drill out both holes you’ll find the holes are very close together in the center of the board. In hind sight I would have shelled out the extra dough and bought the K4 for easier use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: Control issue or design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a Kreg Pocket Hole Jig. I have to admit I like it very much. I'm in the processes of building a round kitchen table. I do however have to say that the Easy Press Positioning Sliders are not so easy. One side is sticking to the point where it takes me more time getting it unstuck, then to complete the project. I'm not sure if this is quality control issue or bad design flaw. Whatever the case, it's very annoying to say the least. Despite this issue I think it's still a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Get the master version with clamp instead
customer_reviews.text: It guides the bit to make nice pocket screw holes when it stays still but it is difficult to keep it from walking around while drilling even with the kreg face clamp that is compatible with the grey plastic part. I was using it with cellular PVC trim that is a bit more slippery than unfinished wood. I also have the kreg master kit with the built in clamp and and that is much more user friendly. If you plan on a lot of use I would get the master version - worth the $ to save the frustration of walking bits.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had never worked with pocket holes before but this was extremely easy to use. The directions were very clear for the set up and I was easily able to make great connections for my wooden pieces. I would recommend this to a beginner in the woodworking hobby as it is much cheaper than the whole jig. Set up time wasn't bad at all, and once I got a system going I was able to get all my holes made very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pocket holes
customer_reviews.text: I've drilled probably hundreds of pocket holes with this jig since I purchased it. It works as expected, and makes good, strong joints. I HIGHLY recommend the Kreg clamp that fits on the clamp pad of the jig, as without it, the jig is very difficult to use. For the occasional user, and not a pro, this jig is perfect, and I think is well worth the upgrade over the single-hole jig. Thanks for a very fine product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere near worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly, my bit seems to have arrived bent. Have not been able to secure it to the drill in such a way so that it doesn't wobble terribly, rendering the whole thing fairly useless. I may replace the bit but the jig itself is so cheap and difficult to secure in place that I probably won't bother. Will be looking for one built a little better. Would be willing to pay this much for one that would be in my toolkit for life. This is definitely not that jig
customer_reviews.author: Amahuna

customer_reviews.title: Im sure if it came with instructions it would be easeir to use
customer_reviews.text: Never having used one of these it is very difficult to know what to do with it. The instructions are written for someone who understands the lingo. I am not a handyman, Im a tinkerer. Watched a few youtube videos and kind of figured it out. Might like it better once I know how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mohler

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about this jig years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known about this jig years ago- it makes assembly projects so much faster and easier. Every part of it is thoroughly thought through, including the case that holds all the pieces. I have used it with both the Kreg clamp and generic clamps, and have found that the Kreg clamp holds a little more securely, probably because it snaps into the collared platform, making it easy to align the clamp and the jig. If I had any complaints, it would be that the clamping platform detaches a little too easily, and the grey sliders are a bit fiddly. Nonetheless, this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: Stevil

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: Had I know the ease and strength of joints made with this pocket jig I would have purchased one years ago. Believe me if you are on the fence on whether to purchase this product BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.author: MDD

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. I would buy this over and over again. So simply and fast. Trust me on this one you don't need anything more than this.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for fixing previous built projects.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Kreg K4 a few years back. Use it all the time. But it has limits. That is why in addition I bought this. Works great as a stand alone. But the reason I bought it is you can use this for projects that are partially assembled if you need to add a screw or two or if you need to fix a project that is already built. These are a little pricey but you will get a lot of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: SUP

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I use this constantly and really like its function besides trying to adjust it for different projects. Definitely a must have for any type of dyi project ms in the garage or shop
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, sturdy joints
customer_reviews.text: The pocket hole jig system is a great buy for the do-it yourself(er) or handyman. The system takes a little getting used to but it makes that aspect of carpentry a breeze. The joint and seams are extremely tight and provide a sturdy union. It is small enough to carry around and yet it is great for small and large projects alike. The depth scale makes it nearly impossible to drill in too deep and ruin the joint. I highly recommend this tool for every tool box.
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: best value for the money
customer_reviews.text: i was hesitant about buying it because i really didnt want to spend the money. but the cheaper units seems to have bad reviews and i didnt want to waste my money. this was worth every penny and i dont do much woodworking to justify this purchase but now i want to build more stuff because this thing is amazing. it is so easy to use. just take your time and read the instructions and you'll understand how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Younes

customer_reviews.title: Well..it can be helpful with some effort and research.
customer_reviews.text: It's not very intuitive. Have a friend teach you, or watch some YouTube tutorials. But the product works well enough. Often the screw to stop the drill bit from going too deep into the wood unscrews and that's frustrating, but if you can get past that, then this is still helpful to make pocket holes. But you really need to know what you're doing beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Makes pocket holes easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I built a sliding barn door using this and it came out exactly how I wanted. It was easy to use. I think this is perfect for those who do projects occasionally. If I had had the time to do more woodworking projects, I would have upgraded to the better jig. I did end up buying the Kreg clamp as well. I assume you can use vice grips or other wide mouth locking pliers in lieu of the Kreg model.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any wood working garage!
customer_reviews.text: Saw a video on YouTube where they used the Kreg Jig to fasten storage shelves to the wall. This works awesome! The only thing I couldn't find at my big box store were additional (non-Kreg branded) screws to work with it. You need washer-head screws. I tried inserting standard deck screws (used up my Kreg screws that came with it) but the heads were not wide enough to draw the wood firmly in place. I just decided to order additional Kreg screws (slight premium to standard).
customer_reviews.author: Sparty93

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to get started
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to using pocket hole joinery so it seemed this starter kit would be a perfect way to get started. I am pretty happy with it so far but still need some more practice. Overall this package will, undoubtedly serve me well once I get the hang of it. It has everything one needs to get started. I did buy more screws to go with it and recommend that you do also. Nice kit😉
customer_reviews.author: B2Jones

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the high price! Robertson bit is a bit slippery
customer_reviews.text: These are so incredibly easy to use. I managed to frame up some closet shelves with this in under 30 minutes by using one of these! Dead easy to use, and will save so much time over trying not to split wood by driving screws straight down the grain of the wood. My only gripe is the Robertson bit that is included will spin a bit. Not as bad as a Philips screw, but I guess I am just spoiled using star / hex screws.
customer_reviews.author: Mike The Tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: All in all great tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this jig. First time user and from open box to installed pocket hole board in 5 minutes. Set up was easy with the settings built into the case itself. Wish the driver was standard Phillips or even better changeable. But it’s not which locks you into buying their overpriced but good screws. That’s why I knocked off a star in versatility. But all in all great tool.
customer_reviews.author: DF_EE

customer_reviews.title: Honestly best tool I have bought for under 50$
customer_reviews.text: So I went looking to buy a solid wood media cabinet/bookshelf that was about 96" tall and 7ft wide. Didn't feel like paying 2-3 thousand dollars. So I decided to build my own the way I wanted it. But I have a miter saw and a router that was from my father. So I bought this jig,a pack of 500 screws, some nice oak lumber with matching dowels to plug the holes and a bit of stain. I built it for probably 1/4 of the cost of a furniture store. I have minimal experience with wood working but this project came together beautifully. I don't think I could have done this without this tool.
customer_reviews.author: J Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had a chance to build anything nice yet, because my table saw needed to be ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY handy tool! I haven't had a chance to build anything nice yet, because my table saw needed to be tuned up. The first thing I built was a simple 4-sided box for practice and it immediately showed me how bad the saw as set up! Even then I could tell it will make making things hassle free. I did end up buying a clamp to go with it since screwing the pieces together without a clamping device allows them to move enough to leave them slightly uneven. My saw is tuned up now and I will be re-cutting that box and trying it again. I expect a less crooked box in the end!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulliberger

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for simple projects, but nothing compares to a mortise/tenon or dovetail joint for strength and reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for simple projects, but nothing compares to a mortise/tenon or dovetail joint for strength and reliability. DO NOT use these joints for structural/load-bearing structures. They're great for low-stress and cosmetic joints, but I see far too many youtube "carpenters" using these to provide structural support for "heavy duty" shelves, bunk beds, loft bed/desk units, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sifo Dyas

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Hot DAMN do I love this tool! I’ve owned the Kreg for 8 years and it is (was) still in great shape, working like a champ! I say “was” because MY BOYFRIEND LOST IT AND NOW I HAVE TO BUY ANOTHER 😑 It’s made: Custom kitchen cabinets (5 base, 4 wall) Custom furniture (Armoire, shoe racks, entertainment console) Kitchen island Gifts for friends and family ( chests, bookcases, and an entry way bench) Bathroom doors (2 sliding and one weird pocket door) When it’s back in stock, buy the sh!t out of it. I will.
customer_reviews.author: NKD

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago...
customer_reviews.text: Kreg is the best! My friend had one of these and the first time I saw him pull it out I knew I had to buy one. Now I go around the house finding things to build out of wood so I can use the pocket hole jig. I love it! I built some shelves in our basement and the jig worked awesome and hid the screws where they wont be seen! If you are reading this right now you know you want to buy one so do it!
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool I should have started using years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Received in 1 day! This is a great product and simple to use. Only suggestion after completing a project is to set the depth of the drill bit a little deeper in order for the Kreg plugs to set properly without much cutting. I have to test this a bit more to see if it makes the joint weaker though. This kit comes with everything you need.
customer_reviews.author: MkDsn

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product, unfortunately the drill stop was missing the screw to secure it. I used painter tape to visually know when to stop. I ended up cutting two extra pieces due to not stopping in time and the tape moving. I was able to complete my project. I ordered a set of replacement drill stops in different sizes, hopefully one will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: If you ever build shelves or cabinets or tables or workbenches or anything like that, you definitely need this. I had the little single one first and it took forever to line it up every time and clamp down but didnt have the money to upgrade to the big expensive one so I got this and it is perfect. Just get a face clamp it makes drilling pocket holes a breeze. The case is very nice to have. You just slide the bit in the slot and it shows you exactly where to put your bit stop for different size wood. Very nice little kit
customer_reviews.author: Craig carter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set and even easier to use.
customer_reviews.text: These are a must for building quality projects. Easy to set and even easier to use. You get pretty quick with this after a while. I've only used it for assembling 2x4's but have found the joints to be extremely durable even under some strenuous situations. Pair this with the Kreg Tension Clamp and you'll be flying through pocket holes in no time. At first use, there were some blue shaving coming off the jig. Concerned at first, but after about 20 holes, the shavings ceased, but the integrity of the jig remained. Pair this with the Blue Coated 2.5" screws and you have yourself an amazing piece of furniture that will stand the variable Colorado weather.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing system! I built bookcases and a cabinet with the Kreg system. This particular jig is great for off site projects and repairs, to hard to get places that you can’t put on your workbench. I also recommend the workbench jig for bigger projects where you have to duplicate many things. I can’t say enough good things about the Kreg system. It’s phenomenal!
customer_reviews.author: cdl221

customer_reviews.title: Works great for smaller projects
customer_reviews.text: Works great for smaller projects. I went ahead and bought their specific clamp and that made it a good bit easier to use. As an experiment, I used it to build a fence gate of treated 2x4's. I only made pocket holes and glue. So far the gate has held up as well as the other gate I made with half lap joints, screws and glue. While time will tell which gate is more durable, the jig made it really easy to drill all the pocket holes correctly.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool that makes life infinitely easier. All my fasteners are hidden and the joints are strong and lasting. I highly revommend this tool to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: 1960 Chevy Pickup

customer_reviews.title: Came defective, but still works
customer_reviews.text: One of the pocket hole slots is completely closed. I tried popping it out and drilling through it, but couldn't fix it. But i was just able to move the jig and utilize the remaining hole, it just takes twice as long. The clamp they provided is also garbage. The smaller end keeps getting stuck with the end bent backward and I actually have to use concrete steps and a lot of force to unjam it. As far as joining wood together, it does a great job, but the quality is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Pashayan

customer_reviews.title: Missing Part
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my kit came missing the stop screw for the depth collar which makes it a bit more difficult to use. I had to run out and get a different screw so it gets 2 stars solely for the inconvenience. Product works well once all the parts are in place but for the ridiculous premium price of the thing I shouldn't have to drive to town to get a $.56 screw.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pocket Jig was a breeze to use and my project came out with a professional touch. Best to read the easy to follow directions before use because you can mess up your piece if you do not know how to use properly. Took but 5 minutes to make sure I was doing everything correctly but was a breeze once I had it down. Made a blanket ladder for the wife and it blew her mind you couldn't see any screws. ****WILL NEED TO PURCHASE CLAMP TO CLAMP POCKET JIG DOWN TO PIECE***
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: When you need it, you need it. The best tool for the job.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Works like a charm to drill those pocket holes. Easy to adjust for your board depth. There's nothing else quite like a kreg jig. Cons: The screws they include are crap. The adjustable slider feels a bit cheap. Overview:This thing is really cool. Drill pocket holes to connect two pieces of wood without it being obvious. I built a wood countertop with pocket screwed and glued edges. Turned out amazing! Drill bit is very sharp and cuts well, and it's easy to adjust for whatever size boards you're using. Better get the Kreg face clamp though. That makes things easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great tool but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool but the square drive screws and bit suck. These should be star drive, they work so much better and don't slip like the square drive screws and bit do. PLEASE listen to the people that are using these and make star drive screws and bits available for this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Correa

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy kit.
customer_reviews.text: A great jig even for inexperienced woodworkers like myself. After a few holes in a 2x4 to figure out how it works, I made a number of repairs I was putting off. Would recommend buying a screw kit as well - there are a few coming with a jig, but you'll run out quickly. You can use other screws as well of course, but head sizes of Kreg screws are aligned with depth/hole size so they disappear in the hole made.
customer_reviews.author: SY

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold.
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life, Kreg R3 Jr.? I spent a long time pondering whether this jig system was the real deal of just gimmicky. Suffice to say that, with a bit of practice, I have been able to use butt joints again, but this time they are straight and secure. If you are one who loves to work on wood joinery simply for the sake of tradition, I applaud you. But I have never spent the time (or the money on the power tools) to become proficient with it. The Kreg system has converted me. I recommend using the Kreg face clamp. It's another $20, but a worthy investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kelley

customer_reviews.title: 100% awesome
customer_reviews.text: Built a coffee table for my wife, and her #1 request was that she couldn't see the screws. This little tool solved all of her concerns, and more. Not only was I able to build a coffee table with completely hidden screw holes, but an end table, a nightstand, and my wife now has a laundry list of items for me to build (book case, tv stand, wall shelf...)
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for my furniture project.
customer_reviews.text: I was working on a project that suited using pocket hole joinery perfectly. This model met my needs perfectly and was an appropriate price not the cheapest that required greater care to align and use and not the more expensive one that made drilling easy but much more costly. Took very little practice to correctly use and even came with an assortment (I believe 5 of each size) screws and the driver bit. I will definitely be using this for a greater assortment of projects as I'm sold on the ease of use and the hidden fastener. Another great product from Kreg.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Duncan

customer_reviews.title: I realized the best way to use it is to put the holes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experiment with pocket hole joinery, and boy, it's a breeze. I had a broken end table I wanted to repair, and the first couple of holes I tried without reading the instructions, and something wasn't right. I realized the best way to use it is to put the holes in before the product is assembled. I took out the pieces I wanted to join, added the holes, put it back together, and it worked like a charm. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Hurston Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Weekend warriors can expand their repertoires
customer_reviews.text: Wow. A new world open. Chose this over biscuit cutter because of the high cost of the wood clamps I would have needed. This has worked wonderfully. I have used to lock in voard and batten frames for wainscotting and to reinforce treads and risers in our 100 year old fir staircase. No more squeaks. Very happy with the purchase. I note a ton of complementary devices and tools that can accompany and expand the usefulness of this jig set.
customer_reviews.author: Hamou1981

customer_reviews.title: I will probably add more Kreg products to my stable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build some new pantry shelving and to build some cabinet boxes. It makes fastening a breeze. You will still need a jig and clamps to hold the boards firmly in place while you drive the screw, but that is to be expected. I bought this as a compromise in in function and price, but I will add the K4 version to my workshop for smaller pieces; Where this version shines is for larger pieces or sheet goods which would be awkward with the bench top variants. Do not forget to by an appropriate clamp to use with this.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite purchase this year
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very handy, I mostly learn what people would consider common knowledge for building stuff off youtube. I saw someone use this pocket hole online and they kept talking about the brand Kreg so I thought I'd give this one a shot. I don't know much about other brands, but this pocket jig is super easy to use and I've built a bunch of stuff with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the bigger one
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are working with larger panels, this one works better in my opinion. I work with longer pieces so the bigger kreg jig would have required me to work outside or on the ground. This one is very easy to use, hold up well and most importantly DOESN'T COST A FORTUNE. If you are a garage or home woodworker, get this one. I would recommend the bigger clamp though. I got the one with the mini one and it works well but the bigger clamp would make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: JD718

customer_reviews.title: High quality/Great value
customer_reviews.text: I love Kreg brand products. They are professional quality and engineering, wtih both the pro and DIY'er in mind. Anyone can use their vast array of craftsmen based-tools. This pocket hole driller is easy to use, does not damage what you are building or repairing and gives a professional finish. Everybody should have one around the house or in the work vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylev

customer_reviews.title: Long time coming
customer_reviews.text: Waited a while on this mechanical fastener technology thinking my woodworking skills surpassed the need for something like this. But dang if it doesn't come in handy. Allows me to make the simply things faster where I'm not concerned about a strong/fancy joint. Hardware stores seem to carry screws locally so no issues there either,
customer_reviews.author: Bob C

customer_reviews.title: Nice set with case, made very well
customer_reviews.text: I was told to buy this brand because of its quality. I liked the case the set came in. Now everything is all together. Instructions included options for using the jig in different ways which is convenient for projects. I would recommend this product. Look for other listings with this jig that include clamps, screws and other attachments. May be cheaper to order separately, so read listings carefully.
customer_reviews.author: LBA

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy using it
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing product, I used it in several applications and glad to purchase and use it. I like those guys in Kreg, Good Products, Good Website, Good Tech support and they care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Mahmoud H.

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. I have built two end tables and a coffee table using these. Has saved me probably 30 hours worth of sanding and wood filling on these 3 projects alone. All joints seem secure, and I have not had a single split board yet. I can't believe I lasting this long without this jig. I would recommend purchasing the Kreg Clamp -- as it snaps into the jig -- and makes things even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kdig14

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help join boards to build a home theater projector. I could not be happier. The boards could not have possibly come out more flush than I was able to accomplish using this adjustable jig. I wish I had heard of it before. It is adjustable to various wood depths and also comes with a guide so that you do not drill the pilot hole too deep. It comes with about 12 pocket screws of each various length and also includes a guide that helps you pick the type for your project. If you need more than 12, you will have to purchase some.
customer_reviews.author: Deke

customer_reviews.title: Pocket screws change the GAME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. Never used a pocket hole kit----saves tons of effort and ups my Carpentry game. Buy the name brand- it's not that much more and you at-least know the quality is there. I'd suggest buying them separate, I didn't realize the clamp they send is a smaller one (not a big deal, but I will be purchasing a large vise grip)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: A useful product
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to make a pocket hole without using this amazing tool. However the clamp that come with your order is very small. The separate clamp for Jig which is bigger is better. I thought they sell the bigger one along with purchasing the Jig tool.
customer_reviews.author: Yashar

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small job.  Beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a carpenter. This is great for a beginner. Or someone who only needs to do a quick build once in a while. If your reading this review then this is probably the one you should get. Someone who knows what they are doing would already have stopped reading this and be looking for the better jig.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Yon

customer_reviews.title: Now I'm Cool?
customer_reviews.text: I watched an instructable that used pocket holes and I didn't know what they were. I wasn't cool. I learned, I bought, I built. Now I can tell stuff to my friends, ending my sentences with a deep inhale through the nose and a firm "yep" which confirms how cool I've become. This is fun and easy to use and I want to build more stuff. My wife is making me paint instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P.

customer_reviews.title: This tool is great for venturing into the world of finer building!
customer_reviews.text: This tool has revolutionized my project building!!! My mother in law and I have worked on little projects for a long time now and I decided it was time to get a jig. We weren't sold on it being such a great tool so we went with the smaller one. I just finished building a 7ft high 6 shelf bookshelf for all my kids and my books and this kreg jig drilled every last hole I needed plus a few perfectly! I would upgrade to the bigger one if you plan on doing a lot of larger woodworking projects though.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Flinn

customer_reviews.title: Cool tool
customer_reviews.text: I’m the best wife! I got this for my husband after watching a tutorial on YouTube on building closet shelves. He loves it and says it’s the best tool. I’ve even used it a couple times and it’s super easy to use and very accurate. It’sa very cool tool.
customer_reviews.author: emily, etc., etc.

customer_reviews.title: Key DIY Woodworking Tool
customer_reviews.text: Critical tool for any DIY woodworker. Very easy to work with, I use it on almost every project. It’s worth the extra money to get the two hole instead of the single and the clamp keeps the jig snug when setting your pockets. There are bigger jigs but if you are just doing DIY projects, this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Buy this but not the Kreg clamp.
customer_reviews.text: I have never used anything like this before, actually this was my first big woodworking project. I built a custom checkout counter for my mother in laws store and had no issues following the instructions and making the holes to hold it all together. Wonderful product. Do NOT buy the clamp that goes with this though, just use a standard C-clamp and it'll work great. The Kreg clamp that goes with this is literal garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Rinn

customer_reviews.title: Pocket holes have never been so easy!
customer_reviews.text: Pocket holes have never been so easy! I have created over 500 pocket holes using this jig and nearly every one of them was perfect. The jig is really durable and isn't showing any signs of wear and the storage case holds everything firmly in its place when not in use. I use this jig with a Kreg face clamp and the combination of the two is fantastic. Set up is very easy. The size of screw, depth, and angle of the hole are all clearly defined depending on what width and type of board you are working with. Fool proof!
customer_reviews.author: SKY

customer_reviews.title: great kit
customer_reviews.text: the downside is the clamp, its on the small side, a bit difficult to use with wood of 1 3/8 and over. on a 5/8 thick wood its very easy to use. on a thick boards its getting a bit tricky to be accurate. I had a hard time with 1.5 thick softwood. better to watch some youtube videos before you start, it will save you time, money and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for woodworking
customer_reviews.text: This has made my progress of building a dining table a whole lot easier and clean. Unbelievably easy to use and all needed pieces are already included. Note, the additional clamp didn't do me any good as it would not extend to clamping the Kreg onto a 12x2 board... It's a good, solid clamp but it doesn't open wide enough to secure so I ended up using my own 12" clamps to hold while drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Hole Jig
customer_reviews.text: Having never before used pocket holes while constructing a coffee table, I thought I would give this system a try. I really like it. It is easy to set up and creates good holes for pocket screws. The end result was a stable, well-constructed base for the table top. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Some Imperfections.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a 5 but one of the gray depth adjustment thing, after maybe 15 or 20 holes, would not lock into position. Finally I took them both off and put a little pressure on the squeeze to adjust spot and it was nice and firm. I did the same to the other one and the tab broke and fell off. It was not abused nor dropped. It's probably just a manufactures defect. But nonetheless, I had it shipped to me in South America at a considerable cost and I doubt I'll ever get a part to replace it. Other than that, it worked great until then.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for field work and small projects holder
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this jig to do some field repairs to some face frames. Works great. I would recommend this for fieldwork. Well designed and thought through. Easy to dial in and set up your requirements. I have an older pocket screw jig, but this one is much nicer to use.
customer_reviews.author: DMann

customer_reviews.title: First jig, so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: New to woodworking, never used a pocket jig before, this thing is beyond easy to use. Great way to get my feet wet without spending a fortune. The R3 w/ face clamp has everything I need to make some initial test joints and help me figure out which screws I'll need for the main project.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but sliding guide rails are crap
customer_reviews.text: The jig worked well but after my first project with it, one of the guide rails was stuck. The rails were clunky out of the box but after a little use, one side completely froze up. Also, they make this clamp look way bigger for the product photo. It's the smallest clamp available but worked perfectly on the 1.5" boards I was working with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. The reason being is I lost my first one in the move. Since this being my second purchase will ensure that this product will be your go-to for all your DIY needs for wood working! I can’t say it enough!
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: There are many options for hole jig kit. I'm so glad that I decided to spend a little more to get this one. The kit comes in a very nice case. The tool is very easy to use with thickness guides on the drill bit and the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlesucks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and cost effective addition to my shop
customer_reviews.text: This little guy works wonders. I used it to build a trellis for the back yard. Excellent and cost effective addition to my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Piltingsrud

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about how wonderful this tool is. I feel like I should have purchased this a long time ago. It has taken my building to the next level. I never considered building furniture until now. My first project using it was this Farm table I build for my wife. I couldn't believe how strong this makes my build. Combining the boards to make the top of the table was a lot easier using this tool on the bottom. It would grip so tight, that I could see the glue squeezing out of the seems!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin L Poplar

customer_reviews.title: Mobile and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I chose this because I wanted the more mobile unit. It’s solid and easy to calibrate. You need the box it comes in to set the collar depth, and check the instructions for screw length according to the thickness of your material. Also, make sure you’re drilling into materials properly. Remember this is a type of joinery and there are correct and incorrect ways to do it. Enjoy all your great projects with this!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex & Kesia

customer_reviews.title: Helps me drill pocket holes, just as expected!  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This pocket hole jig is super simple, easy to use, easy to set up, an overall great buy ifnypi do a little woodworking or a lot. I really love it, use this for building my bathroom vanity and towel cabinet, my entertainment center, a few bookshelves, I really dig it.
customer_reviews.author: D.Schibel

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works fine and is simple to set up. The only thing I don't like is it moves around a bit while using even when clamped tight. I have not had to use it anywhere that the accuracy of the hole really mattered, but if I did I would be hesitant.
customer_reviews.author: spotco2

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this. Not something you would use to build custom cabinets for your kitchen but very good for smaller projects. Never knew how much better pocket joints were vs just screwing or brad nailing. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N.

customer_reviews.title: Won't build anything without it
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted to make pocket holes and never knew how until I say a video and realized that I needed this product. I love it and use it all the time whenever I build something. Comes with everything you need to get started even comes with two different types of screws for you to use. Comes with a nice sturdy case that you can use when you are not using your jig. Easy to follow instructions.
customer_reviews.author: danraoul

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long??
customer_reviews.text: Finally stepping up to pocket holes for my projects. The system is so easy to use and the connection this system makes is super strong. Built my table saw cart using pocket holes and turned out great! So glad i finally got the Kreg system.
customer_reviews.author: dmr

product_meta.title: Kreg Jig R3 Pocket Hole System
product_meta.description: Style:Jig System"The home improvers solution for building with wood with the Keg jig R3, you can build bookcases, shelves, and storage projects for your home. It's also great for creating custom built-ins, and countless other home improvement projects. Plus, the Keg jig R3 can be used portable to make lasting repairs around your home. clamp pad adapter the Keg jig R3 includes a clamp pad adapter, which allows the R3 to be easily secured to your work piece using any standard bar clamp, C-Clamp, or Keg face clamp. For faster and more repeatable pocket holes, choose a Keg face clamp. Organized carrying case compact yet durable carrying case is included so that you'll always have a safe place to store your Keg jig R3 and organize all of the accessories It comes with. As a bonus, a depth-collar gauge has been molded into the case for handy reference. Hardened-steel corker drill guides are subject to direct contact with the drill bit every time A pocket hole is created. The core of every Keg jig R3 features hardened-steel, which carries a lifetime . The Keg jig r3’s core shrouds the bit and supports the work piece through 100% of the drill-stroke. The end result is minimal bit deflection, reduced tear-out, and a clean, pluggable pocket hole fit for finish work. "
